intro: Turritis arvensis, commonly known as the field bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Turritis arvensis is a short-lived perennial that blooms from late summer to early autumn.
